Package controller

Class StoreManager

java.lang.Object
controller.StoreManager
public class StoreManager extends Object
This class handles all the main navigation between classes Loads the text file into an array list of toys Handles the logic for the user creating or removing a toy Writes the array list with any new changes back to the txt file Throws the exceptions for a negative price and for if the min is greater than the max when creating a board game
Version:
SDK corretto-11
Author:
Daniel, Prince

  • Method Details

    • loadFile

      public void loadFile() throws FileNotFoundException
      Method that loads the file then stores it as an array list of toys
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - If the file is not in the directory stops code

    • start

      public void start() throws IOException
      This method initiates the program First calls the start menu, and recieves a char, the char is then returned to be used to navigate other methods. Being, Searching for a toy, remvoing a toy, adding a toy, or terminating the program
      Throws:
      IOException - checks if the file is found at a specific location

    • purchase

      private void purchase(Toys wantedToy) throws IOException
      This method checks if the available count is zero, if it is zero remove from the list. If the available count is greater than zero, this method minuses one from the toal available count.
      Parameters:
      wantedToy - this is a toy that the user wants to purchase
      Throws:
      IOException - In case File is not found

    • isSerialNumValid

      public void isSerialNumValid(String serialNum) throws IOException
      This method validates if the prompted Serial Number is a valid message, by checking if the Serial Number has 10 digits, has only integers, and if the Serial Number already exists in the toyList array
      Parameters:
      serialNum - : The prompted serial number from the user
      Throws:
      IOException

    • userAddToy

      public void userAddToy() throws IOException
      This method asks the User for descriptions for a toy, specifically asking the Serial Number (if it is valid), and the general attributes of a toy, and if the serial number's first digit is a specific number, asks for specific attributes to pertains to the specific category.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • userRemoveToy

      private char userRemoveToy() throws IOException
      This method removes a toy, by prompting a Serial Number, then checks the whole ArrayList and gets the index of the prompted number and removes the toy from the list.
      Returns:
      userRemoveToyInputChar User input if they want to remove the selected Toy
      Throws:
      IOException - checks if the file exists at a given location

    • serialNumberValidation

      public String serialNumberValidation() throws IOException
      This method prompts the user for a Serial Number, checks if the number is 10 digits long, has no letters, or if the item already exists in the ArrayList, similar to the first Validation, but returns the prompted String
      Returns:
      toySerialNumber The user input for Serial Number
      Throws:
      IOException - checks if the file is found in a particular destination

    • findToySerialNumber

      private ArrayList<Toys> findToySerialNumber() throws IOException
      This method searches for a Toy through a prompted message, if the toy is in the array, return the toy
      Returns:
      ArrayList This list holds 1 serial number that is identical to User input.
      Throws:
      IOException - Checks if a file is found at a specific destination

    • findIdenticalType

      private ArrayList<Toys> findIdenticalType()
      This method prompts the user with 4 choices to list all toys with the same category, returns all the identical category toys
      Returns:
      ArrayList this holds all the toys that has the same category

    • findToyName

      private ArrayList<Toys> findToyName() throws IOException
      This method prompts the user with a toy name, if the toy name string is found within another string of a toy's add that toy to an arrayList and return it
      Returns:
      findToyName returns all the toys that contains UserInput
      Throws:
      IOException

    • exit

      private void exit() throws IOException
      This method prints an ending message, and in the file prints each toy into the arraylist with the new changes the user might have left
      Throws:
      IOException

    • saving

      public void saving() throws IOException
      This method goes through each toy, and depending on it's first digit in the Serial Number, would print the category specific toy description including its unique properties. Separated by semi-colons.
      Throws:
      IOException
